title: 109_hr1561
content: The "Childhood Adoption Act of 2005" increases allowable expenses for adoption and makes the adoption credit refundable. The "Childhood Adoption Act of 2005" increases the dollar limitation for the adoption credit from $10,000 to $15,000, including a $15,000 credit for the adoption of a child with special needs. The dollar amounts in subsections (a)(3) and (b)(1) will be increased for taxable years after December 31, 2005, based on the cost-of-living adjustment determined for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins. If the increased amount is not a multiple of $10, it will be rounded to the nearest multiple of $10. "Income limitations for taxable years after December 31, 2002, will be adjusted based on the cost-of-living adjustment for that calendar year. Any adjusted amount not a multiple of $10 will be rounded to the nearest multiple of $10." The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to increase the dollar limitation from $10,000 to $15,000 for adoption expenses. This adjustment also applies to children with special needs. Additionally, there is a conforming amendment to inflation adjustments. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to increase dollar limitations for adoption expenses in taxable years after December 31, 2005. Dollar amounts in subsections (a)(2) and (b)(1) will be adjusted for inflation based on the cost-of-living adjustment for the calendar year. If the adjusted amount is not a multiple of $10, it will be rounded to the nearest multiple of $10. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to increase dollar limitations for adoption expenses in taxable years after December 31, 2005. The dollar amount in subsection (b)(2)(A)(i) will be adjusted for inflation and rounded to the nearest multiple of $10. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to redesignate sections and make conforming amendments to various sections within the code. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to redesignate sections and make conforming amendments, including striking and inserting specific section numbers in various parts of the code. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by redesignating sections and making conforming amendments, including changes to the table of sections for subpart C of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1. The amendments include adoption expenses and overpayments of tax, effective for taxable years starting after December 31, 2004. Additionally, there is an increase in adoption incentive payments. SEC. 3. INCREASE IN ADOPTION INCENTIVE PAYMENTS. The Social Security Act is amended to increase adoption incentive payments from $4,000 to $8,000 in various subparagraphs. Program funding is also increased to $86,000,000 for each fiscal year from 2006 to 2008.
